page.title: 13TREWITHEN ESTATE
page.content: TREWITHEN ESTATE. Trewithen Estate is much smaller now than in its heyday,but it still consists of about 10,000 acres.1,500 acres are farmed directly by the estate the rest is leased.Farming methods have changed since the Second World War:winter corn has been introduced & as grass is the best crop to grow in Cornwall,a balance is made between corn & cattle.Other new crops are being introduced eg.oil seed rape, which is used for cooking oil & margarine.Trewithen has always led the way in new farming techniques:the first steam threshing machine to be used in Cornwall was here,& nowadays computers have been introduced for stock taking etc.The owner believes that tradition gives a degree of stability but it must not stifle good,new ideas.
